Roman.name: Gaius Julius Caesar
Roman.description: Julius Caesar was a leader of ancient Rome who significantly transformed what became known as the Roman Empire by greatly expanding its geographic reach and establishing its imperial system. Allegedly a descendant of Trojan prince Aeneas, Caesarâ€™s birth marked the beginning of a new chapter in Roman history. By age 31, Caesar had fought in several wars and become involved in Roman politics. After several alliances and military victories, he became dictator of the Roman Empire, a rule that lasted for just one year before his death in 44 BCE.

Roman.name: Mark Antony
Roman.description: Marcus Antonius, known in English as Mark Antony, was a Roman politician and general. A loyal supporter of Julius Caesar, he played a critical role in the transformation of the Roman Republic into the Roman Empire. His love affair with Cleopatra and subsequent defeat by Octavian (later Augustus) marked the end of his political career.

Roman.name: Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus
Roman.description: Pompeius Magnus, known as Pompey the Great, was a leading Roman general and statesman of the late Republic. He formed part of the First Triumvirate and was known for his military exploits and rivalry with Julius Caesar.

Roman.name: Legionnaire
Roman.description: A Roman legionnaire was a heavily armed and armored soldier, known for their discipline and training, forming the backbone of Rome's military might.
